name: Family Member Report - Elderly Father Wheelchair Failure
description: Adult child reporting on behalf of elderly parent about powered wheelchair malfunction causing fall.

headers.subject: Wheelchair malfunction - my father was injured

raw_input.body:
Hello,

I am writing on behalf of my father, William Martinez (age 82), who was injured yesterday when his powered wheelchair malfunctioned.

My father has been using the MobilityPlus PowerGlide 3000 wheelchair for about 18 months. He has limited mobility due to a stroke he had 3 years ago and relies on the wheelchair to get around his assisted living facility.

Yesterday morning (April 9), he was using the wheelchair to go to breakfast when the brakes suddenly engaged while he was moving forward at normal speed. The sudden stop threw him forward out of the chair. He hit his head on the floor and also injured his right wrist trying to catch himself.

The staff at Sunrise Senior Living called 911 and he was taken to St. Mary's Hospital. He has a concussion and a fractured wrist. He's still in the hospital and they want to keep him for observation because of his age.

The wheelchair model is PowerGlide 3000, serial number PG3K-2022-56234. It was provided through Medicare in October 2022.

The facility has kept the wheelchair and said they won't let anyone use it until this is resolved.

I am his healthcare proxy and can provide any additional information you need. Please contact me at this email or call (555) 777-8899.

Thank you,
Jennifer Martinez

event_info.event_description: Powered wheelchair brakes suddenly engaged while patient was moving forward at normal speed. Sudden stop ejected patient from chair. Patient struck head on floor and injured wrist trying to catch himself.
event_info.patient_outcome: Concussion and fractured right wrist, hospitalized for observation
event_info.device_outcome: Wheelchair retained at assisted living facility, taken out of service
event_info.location: Sunrise Senior Living assisted living facility

expected_complaint.narrative: 82-year-old male patient using MobilityPlus PowerGlide 3000 powered wheelchair for 18 months following stroke. On April 9, 2024, wheelchair brakes suddenly engaged while patient was moving forward, causing sudden stop that ejected patient from chair. Patient struck head on floor and injured right wrist. Taken to hospital where he was diagnosed with concussion and fractured wrist. Hospitalized for observation due to age. Wheelchair serial number PG3K-2022-56234, obtained October 2022.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A07/A0704 (Mechanical Problem/Failure to Lock, Seal or Maintain Position) for unexpected brake engagement. C02 (Injury or Damage) for fall injuries. C12 (Hospitalization) as patient was admitted. MDR required due to serious injuries requiring hospitalization.

extraction_challenges: Device obtained through Medicare (no direct purchase)
Patient age and conditions mentioned separately
notes: Good example of family member reporting. Clear narrative despite not being the patient. Facility has secured the device.
